feat.value: …going around with me in every street of the village,
they were striking me, saying,
“This monk took the virginity of our daughter.
Strike him!”
And they struck me.
And I was almost going to die.
And someone, having compassion, said,
“Until when are you striking this monk, a stranger?”
The one who served me was following after me, ashamed.
For they were abusing him
“Is this the anchorite to whom you bear witness?
Look at what he did.”
Then her parents said,
“We will not release him
until he gives a guarantee for himself
[that he will] support her.”
So I spoke to the one who served me
and he guaranteed me.
I went to my cell.
“… necessity,
and you must do a little more work
so that you can support her.”
And I worked night and day, sending to her.
But when the wretched woman came to give birth,
she continued laboring.
And she did not give birth.
They said to her,
“What is this?”
And she said,
“I know,
because I slandered the anchorite,
and I lied about him.
And he did not do anything to me.
But it was some other youth.”
My servant came to me, saying,
“The woman was not able to give birth,
until she confessed,
“The anchorite had nothing to do with me
but I lied about him.”
And look, the whole village wants to come here in order to repent.”
When I heard these things,
so that the people would not bother me,
I came to this place, to Scetis.
This is the reason why I came here.
